variants.Description in input context: Inactivating somatic mutations and frequent intragenic deletions in human malignancies. Mutations occur in the same domains and sometimes at the same residues as germline mutations causing familial Parkinson's disease. Cancer-specific mutations abrogate the growth-suppressive effects of PARK2, decrease E3 ligase activity, and impair ubiquitination of cyclin E, leading to mitotic instability.
Germline mutations in PARK2 cause familial, autosomal recessive Parkinson's disease, resulting in early-onset loss of dopaminergic neurons in the substantia nigra.
